columns.name: id
columns.description: Each answer has a related  response id which is assigned to the specific respondant's response, so that answers for different questions can be tracked between different respondants

columns.name: weight
columns.description: Each respondent has the unique weight value for the whole survey

columns.name: year
columns.description: This explains the year in which the survey was conducted

columns.name: sex
columns.description: The gender of each respondent

columns.name: age
columns.description: The respondent's age of the year during which the survey was conducted

columns.name: age_grp
columns.description: The age group which the respondent belongs to

columns.name: region
columns.description: The region where the respondent comes from

columns.name: gor
columns.description: Respondent's government office region

columns.name: mastat
columns.description: Respondent's marutal status

columns.name: hushop
columns.description: Check whether the respondent is a main shopper

columns.name: hhsize
columns.description: Number of individuals in househould

columns.name: Istage
columns.description: Respondent's life stage

columns.name: nkids
columns.description: Number of children in the household

columns.name: parent
columns.description: Whether the respond is the parent of children

columns.name: ch03
columns.description: Whether the respond has children between 0-3

columns.name: ch45
columns.description: Whether the respond has children between 4-5

columns.name: ch69
columns.description: Whether the respond has children between 6-9

columns.name: ch1015
columns.description: Whether the respond has children/teenager between 10-15

columns.name: qual
columns.description: The question about the highest degree/education of each respondent

columns.name: jbstat
columns.description: Working status of each respondent

columns.name: jbrgsc
columns.description: Social grade

columns.name: hoh
columns.description: Whether the respondent is the chief income earner

columns.name: jbstathoh
columns.description: working status of chief income earner

columns.name: fihhyr2
columns.description: income (only asked to main shopper or chief income earner)

columns.name: fihhyr_a
columns.description: Midpoints of fihhyr2 from 2008 (see notes column for pre-2008)

columns.name: dfihhyr; dfihhyr_a; dfihhyrchg; dfihhyrchg_a
columns.description: There is no data under these columns. For more information please refer to the questionnaire template

columns.name: us
columns.description: Ask the respondent if the household currently owes any money on the following types of loan or credit agreement (list: usa-usj)

columns.name: ustot
columns.description: Question about how much money in total the respondent or household currently owes on these loans

columns.name: answer_text
columns.description: **Please see previous column descriptions for examples** Each answer column should have a description which provides context for the answer (i.e. 1 is low and 10 is high etc). Also, the .JSON file should have a given datatype relevant to the answer provided (usually text or integer).

columns.name: ustot_a
columns.description: Midpoints of ustot after 2006, sum of individual balances on different types of unsecured in 2004 and 2005

columns.name: ustoty_a
columns.description: Unsecured debt to income ratio

columns.name: ustotdy_a
columns.description: Unsecured debt to disposable income ratio

columns.name: xpus
columns.description: Taking into account of your unsecured debts, how much was your last monthly payment on all of the loans?

columns.name: xpus_a
columns.description: Midpoints of xpus. Please refere to last question for more information

columns.name: xpusy_a
columns.description: last monthly unsecured debt payment to income ratio

columns.name: xpusdy_a
columns.description: last monthly unsecured debt payment to disposable

columns.name: usn
columns.description: Number of unsecured debt instruments held

columns.name: usa
columns.description: Unsecured debt instrument: hire purchase

columns.name: usb
columns.description: Unsecured debt instrument: personal loan

columns.name: usc
columns.description: Unsecured debt instrument: credit card

columns.name: usd
columns.description: Unsecured debt instrument: DSS social fund loan

columns.name: ude
columns.description: Unsecured debt instrument: something else

columns.name: usg
columns.description: Unsecured debt instrument: personal loan

columns.name: ush
columns.description: Unsecured debt instrument: overdraft

columns.name: usi
columns.description: Unsecured debt instrument: student loan

columns.name: usj
columns.description: Unsecured debt instrument: store card

columns.name: tenure
columns.description: Housing tenure group

columns.name: tenure_grp2
columns.description: Housing tenure group

columns.name: tenure_grp3
columns.description: Housing tenure group

columns.name: hsval
columns.description: Midpoints of hsval

columns.name: hsval_a
columns.description: Midpoints of hsval

columns.name: reshsfall
columns.description: Over the past year, the price of an average home has fallen by about 10%. How would your household spending on items such as clothes, leisure and groceries be affected if house prices were to fall by another 10% in the next year. Would you say..

columns.name: mghave
columns.description: Question about if there is a mortgage or loan secured on respondent's home

columns.name: intmg
columns.description: Type of interest rate being paid on the mortage or loan

columns.name: mg1tot
columns.description: Roughly how much is left to pay on your current mortgage(s) and secured loan(s) on your home? (only asked to adults responsible for financial decision making)

columns.name: mg1tot_a
columns.description: Midpoints of mg1tot

columns.name: mg1toty_a
columns.description: Secured debt to income ratio

columns.name: mg1totdy_a
columns.description: Secured debt to disposable income ratio

columns.name: nequity
columns.description: If you were able to sell your home today, do you think it would be worth more than what you owe on your mortgage and any other secured loans?

columns.name: xpmg
columns.description: How much was your last monthly instalment on the mortgage(s) or loan(s) related to your home? (only asked to adults responsible for financial decision making)

columns.name: xpmg_a
columns.description: Midpoints of xpmg

columns.name: xpmgy_a
columns.description: last monthly secured debt payment to income ratio

columns.name: xpmgdy_a
columns.description: last monthly secured debt payment to disposable

columns.name: xpmgdy_grp5; fixmg	fixmg09; fixpmg_a; fnxpmg_a; fixpmg09; fnxpmg09; changepmg; changepmg_a; fxuse1; fxuse2; fxuse3; fxuse4; fxuse5; fxuse6; pmguse1; pmguse2; pmguse3; pmguse4; pmguse5; pmguse6; pmguse7; pmguse8
columns.description: There is no data under these columns. For more information please refer to the questionnaire template

columns.name: xphsdf
columns.description: In the past twelve months, would you say you have had any difficulties paying for your accomodation?

columns.name: xphpdf
columns.description: To what extent is the repayment of these loans and the interest a financial burden on your household?
